intro: Psorospermum senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese psorospermum, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Psorospermum senegalense is used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
